title: Mobile Microlearning for Enhanced Adoption of Machine Learning Models and Organizational Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Large-scale professional education conducted in limited technological environments based on smartphones, emphasizing practical learning content applicable to real-world work scenarios

learning_goals: Learners can improve business decision-making processes by applying fundamental principles of machine learning models and explainable AI (XAI) techniques.
Learners can diagnose barriers to the adoption of machine learning models within an organization and derive improvement strategies by applying the Action Design Research (ADR) methodology.
Based on the CRISP-DM methodology, learners can evaluate machine learning models in real-world B2B sales prediction scenarios and measure organizational learning outcomes.

resources: Open-source Machine Learning Tools (Orange, SHAP, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
